data.description: `Native` if running a native blockchain node, `Electrum` if using electrum servers or `Light` for ZHTLC coins.
`Electrum` or `Light` mode only. A standard [ActivationRpcData](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#activation-rpc-data) object.
Confirmations to wait for steps in swap. Defaults to value in the coins file if not set.
For [dPoW](https://komodoplatform.com/en/blog/dpow-demystified/) protected coins, a `true` value will wait for transactions to be notarised when doing swaps. Overrides value if set in `coins` file.
QTUM, UTXO & ZHTLC coins only. A standard [ActivationMode](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#activation-mode) object.

ZHTLC coins only. Path to folder containing [Zcash parameters](https://z.cash/learn/). Defaults to standard location as defined in [this guide](https://forum.komodoplatform.com/t/installing-zcash-params/603)
ZHTLC coins only. Sets the number of scanned blocks per iteration during `BuildingWalletDb` state.
ZHTLC coins only. Sets the interval in milliseconds between iterations of `BuildingWalletDb` state.

Enable transaction history scanning. When active, the Komodo DeFi Framework API will collect transaction history data for local storage, and allow use of the [my_tx_history (v2)](/komodo-defi-framework/api/v20/wallet/tx/my_tx_history/) method.
HD wallets only. Number of addresses to generate. If not specified, addresses will be generated up to `path_to_address::address_index`.

HD wallets only. Whether or not to scan for new addresses. Select from `do_not_scan`, `scan_if_new_wallet` or `scan`. Note that `scan` will result in multple requests to the Komodo DeFi API and may take some time to complete.
HD wallets only. The max number of empty addresses in a row. Transactions sent to an address outside the `gap_limit`, will not be identified when scanning.
HD wallets only. A standard [AddressPath](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#address-path) object.
If `false`, coin and token balances will not be returned in the response, and the response will be returned more quickly.
The URL and port for an electrum server.
WSS only. The URL and port for an electrum server's WSS port.
Transport protocol used to connect to the server. Options: `TCP` or `SSL`
If `true`, this disables server SSL/TLS certificate verification (e.g. for self-signed certificates). **Use at your own risk!**
A standard [BalanceInfo](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#balance-info) object. Not included in responses where `get_balances` is `false`
A standard [DerivationMethod](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/wallet/#derivation-method) object
The public key associated with the seed used to launch Komodo DeFi Framework
A list of tokens which were successfully activated. Only included in responses where `get_balances` is `false`
One of the Coin Types supported by the Komodo DeFi Framework
A standard [CoinProtocolData](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/activation/#coin-protocol-data) object.
Indicates the platform parent coin for EMV-like protocols, or the coin used for lightning nodes.
Either `mainnet` or `testnet`
A standard [ConfirmationTargets](/komodo-defi-framework/api/common_structures/lightning/#confirmation-targets) object.
URL of an RPC node
Must be set to `true` to access RPC nodes run behind [komodo-defi-proxy](https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo-defi-proxy)
Confirmations to wait for steps in swap. Defaults to value in coins file if not set.
Ticker of the token to be enabled
How many confirmations to wait during the transaction steps of an atomic swap. Overwrites value in coins file
Mamimum UTXO count before merge loop is initiated.
How frequently (in blocks) the wallet UTXO count is evaluated.

The maximum nouber of UTXOs to inlude as inputs for a merge transaction. Note that more input UTXOs means a larger transaction and greater fees, and that each blockchain has a limit to the maximum size of a transaction.
